bibl.title: C. H. Smith v. William Cochrane. Commitment
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: United States of America Territory of Washington
To any Constable and the Keeper of the County Jail of said County:

Whereas as a Justice Court held at Slaughter in said County for the tiral of L. H. Smith for the offense hereinafter stated the said L. H. Smith was convicted of having on Sunday evening the 7th day of Octover 1888 in the said County committed a theft and feloniously stolen and taken away from the person of Alexander Anderson a silver watch together with $28 00 in this said County and upon connection the said Court did adjudge and determine that the said I. H. Smith should be imprisoned in the County Jail o this said Count ofr the term of one year.

Therefore you the said Constable are commanded in the name of the United States forthwith to convey and deliever the said I. H. Smith to the said Keeper and you the said Keeper are hereby commanded to receive the said I. H. Smith into your custody in this said Jail and him there safely Keep until the experation of said term of one year or until he shall be discharged by due course of law Dated this 8 Oct 1888

James Hart Justice of the peace for Slaughter Precinct of King County W. T.
Prisoner gives notice of appeal that can fine no bonds here
United States of America Ter T of Washington
Commmitment or Sentence of C H Smith
for Robbery from the person of Alex Anderson
James Hart Justice of the Peace fpr King Co
